dtliExcerpt: Nathan Lane's Gary Essendine is a force of nature, a theatrical tornado that sweeps up everything in its path with irresistible charm and comic timing.
bwwExcerpt: His moral comedy is undiminished. The scene in which he finally calls out the sexual subterfuges of his comrades - and definitively rids himself of his own extraneous women - successfully counterweights the play's many trivialities.
